page.title: 10The Parish Council.
page.content: The Parish Council consists of 9 unpaid members who meet once a month except for August.The clerk is paid 597 pounds per annum.The council is responsible for open spaces and the closed church- yard.One person is employed to mow the grass and he is paid 1,100 pounds p.a. The District Council contributes 2,300 pounds p.a.This means that there is not much money to work with.They are responsible for footpaths and if stiles are broken they ask the landowner to repair them.They keep a careful watch on the environment such as noise level created by the local aerodrome.If the roads are in a bad state of repair,the Council reports this to the County Council.The main project in 1985 is the clearing of Pheasants Hill Common where no-one will take responsibility of ownership.This will take 10 years.They also give advice on planning.
